snippet: One World Trade Center will soon return the title of tallest American building to New York City. But time was when the city tried to severely limit building height.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on the history of skyscrapers in New York City; recalls a time when the city tried to severely limit building height, a stark contrast to the praise of 1 World Trade Center, which will soon top out at 1,776 feet.
lead_paragraph: One World Trade Center will soon return the title of tallest American building to New York City. But time was when the city tried to severely limit building height.

headline.print_headline: Thieves of Light, Built by Barbarians
headline.main: Thieves of Light, Built by Barbarians
